si.t: Category
Operational Office
Process
0. Executive Strategy & Governance
1. Board Governance & Trustee Relations
Supports the university’s governing body and ensures institutional accountability.
Prepare and distribute board meeting materials, minutes, and dockets
Maintain bylaws, governance charters, and trustee policies
Coordinate board committee schedules and communications
Facilitate trustee onboarding, training, and records
Track and support trustee engagement and philanthropic involvement
2. Executive Communications
Manages the voice and visibility of executive leadership, especially the Office of the President.
Draft presidential speeches, messages, and public statements
Coordinate leadership messaging for strategic initiatives and milestones
Oversee executive-level correspondence, talking points, and event remarks
Collaborate on crisis communication and official institutional positions
Manage internal updates from leadership (e.g., town halls, newsletters)
3. Strategy and Planning
Leads institutional strategy, performance measurement, and accreditation planning.
Facilitate university-wide strategic planning cycles and progress tracking
Conduct benchmarking, SWOT analysis, and strategic forecasting
Maintain institutional KPIs, dashboards, and data visualizations
Coordinate strategic initiatives and cross-functional project teams
Support mission alignment and long-range planning documents
4. Legal Affairs
Manages institutional legal risk, contracts, and policy compliance.
Review and negotiate institutional contracts and agreements
Coordinate responses to subpoenas, legal claims, and investigations
Advise on regulatory compliance and employment law
Support policy development and legal review processes
Retain and liaise with external legal counsel as needed
5. Government Relations
Represents the institution to local, state, and federal agencies.
Monitor and respond to proposed legislation impacting higher education
Cultivate relationships with elected officials and government agencies
Coordinate campus visits, advocacy days, and briefings
Prepare legislative updates and issue briefs for campus leaders
Align advocacy with institutional goals and funding priorities
6. Global Affairs / International Programs
Coordinates international engagement, compliance, and global mobility.
Administer visa services and immigration support for students and faculty
Support study abroad and faculty exchange programs
Manage institutional partnerships with international universities
Track international MOUs and agreements
Promote global learning and intercultural programming
1. Enrollment Services
1. Marketing and Recruiting
Event Management for Recruitment
Lead Generation & List Purchase Management
Manage Prospect Communications
2. Admissions
Admissions Decision Processing (review workflows, committee decisions, automated rules)
Admissions Reporting & Analytics
Application Fee Processing
Collect Applications Documents
Conditional/Provisional Admit Tracking
Deferral & Waitlist Management
Generate Offer Letters & Decision Notifications
International Admissions Support (visa documentation, SEVIS reporting, I-20 processing)
Matriculation Confirmation Tracking (intent to enroll, deposit tracking if applicable)
New Student processes
Process Applications
Receive and Record Transcripts (for incoming/admitted students)
Test Score Processing (e.g., SAT, ACT, GRE, TOEFL)
Track Applicant Status & Manage Applicant Portal
3. Student Financial Services (FinAid)
Aid Packaging and Award Letter Generation
Collect and Process Financial Aid Applications
Coordination with Veterans Affairs (VA Benefits Processing)
Disbursement of Financial Aid to Student Accounts
FAFSA and Verification Processing
Financial Aid Appeals & Special Circumstances Processing
Maintain Financial Aid Regulatory Compliance
Manage Federal Work Study Funds (financial-aid side; some overlap with Finance)
Process Financial Aid Awards
Process Student Loans
Return of Title IV (R2T4) Calculations
Satisfactory Academic Progress (SAP) Monitoring
Scholarship Administration
Student Debt Counseling & Financial Wellness Programs (front-line counseling; financial transactions go under #4)
3. Student Financial Services (StuFin)
1098-T Tax Form Processing
Collect and Process Payments
Print and Distribute Statements
Process Charges and Fees
Process non-tuition fees (bookstore, parking, dorms)
Refund Funds (if disbursed by the Bursar)
Student Payment Plans & Collections Management
Third-Party Billing & Sponsorships
4. Registrar (Enrollment Progression)
Evaluate and Apply Transfer Credit
Manage Articulation Agreements and Course Equivalencies
Manage Grade Changes and Incompletes
Manage Holds and Registration Blocks
Monitor and Update Academic Standing (e.g., probation, suspension, dismissal, reinstatement)
Process Graduation
Process Student Withdrawals, Leaves of Absence, and Reinstatements
Process Students upon Graduation (final clearance tasks if not handled by Registrar)
Produce and Distribute Diplomas
Register Students
4. Registrar (Reporting and Compliance)
Process International Students
Provide Enrollment and Degree Verification (e.g., NSC, insurance letters)
Support Registrar Reporting Requirements (e.g., IPEDS, state/federal compliance)
Transmit Transcripts as Requested
4. Registrar (Student Records)
Change of Major / Program Process
Conduct Student Record Audits for Accuracy and Compliance
FERPA Access Management
Maintain and Process Preferred Names
Manage FERPA Permissions and Access Requests
New Student Set-up
Process Academic Record (transcripts, academic history)
Process Legal Name, SSN, and Demographic Updates
Process Student Paperwork (forms, petitions, etc.)
Record Test Scores
Support Student Self-Service Portals (registration, records, requests)
2. Student Services
Housing
Maintain Housing Records
Student Activities
Clubs and Student Leadership
Manage and Promote Student Activities (clubs, organizations, events)
Orientation registration
Service Learning Coordination
Support Student Social Networking
Student Affairs
General Student Communication
General Student Services Processing
Maintain Student Information (non-academic personal data; academic records often go under #3)
Manage Student ID Badges (for students; employee badges go under HR)
Student Conduct
Academic Integrity Case Management
Maintain Chapel Attendance Records
Student Conduct & Behavior Management
Student Health
Student Health and Immunizations
Student Mental Health and Counseling Support
Student Support
Disability Services & Accommodations
Diversity, Inclusion & Belonging Initiatives
First-Generation Student Support
First-Year Experience & Student Transition Programs
Food & Housing Insecurity Resources / Basic Needs Programs
Internship & Job Placement Support
Manage Student Satisfaction
Student Parents and Family Services
Veteran & Military-Connected Student Services
3. Academic Services
0. Academic Administration
Maintain academic calendars, catalogs, and bulletins in coordination with academic leadership.
Coordinate faculty governance support, including academic committees and shared governance structures.
Oversee academic policy development, approval workflows, and official publication.
Support curriculum and program governance processes (e.g., new program approval, course changes).
Manage institutional academic handbooks and related communications (e.g., Faculty Handbook, Academic Bulletin).
Coordinate accreditation and academic compliance reporting (if not housed separately).
Facilitate academic leadership meetings and documentation (e.g., Deans’ Council, Senate).
1. Curriculum & Program Management
Maintain Degree Completion Requirements
Maintain Program Information (program structures, changes)
Track Program Learning Outcomes (PLOs)
Coordinate Program Review Process (multi-year evaluation cycles)
Manage Curriculum Committee Workflows (proposal intake, approval tracking)
2. Academic Advising & Student Planning
Academic Advising and Retention Strategies (if Student Affairs leads retention)
Advise Students (academic advising sometimes bridges #2 and #3; place according to your org chart)

r.t: Manage Academic Planning Tools
(e.g., DegreeWorks, Stellic — technical and advising-side usage)
Record and Track Advising Notes
(for continuity and compliance)
Schedule Advising Appointments
(either system-side or operational coordination)
Track Student Progress Toward Degree
(support intervention alerts or graduation readiness)
Coordinate Early Alert / At-Risk Intervention
(if advising is the response arm)

si.t: 3. Catalog and Scheduling
Maintain and Publish Catalog Information
Maintain and Publish Course Schedule
Publish Program Information (program catalogs, degree info)

r.t: Coordinate Course Scheduling Logistics
(instructor availability, time blocks, modality preferences)
Integrate Course Schedule with Room & Space Assignments
(if managed here)
Track Course Modality (online, hybrid, in-person)
— increasingly needed for federal/state reporting
Manage Course Inventory
(create/update course shells, track inactive or obsolete courses)

si.t: 4. Course & Section Management
Approve new sections, manage instructor-of-record assignments
Maintain Course Attendance
Maintain Course Information
Maintain Faculty Records (if this refers to teaching assignments, courses taught, etc.)
Monitor faculty assignment balance across multiple terms or programs
Manage Course Evaluations
Process Textbook Orders
Record Course Grades (Registrar often sits here)
5. Faculty Development and Progression
Faculty Mentoring & Leadership Development (if academically focused; could also be HR if it’s formal performance management)
Coordinate academic rank advancement processes
Track portfolio submissions, peer reviews, and timelines
Support individualized or department-driven development plans
Organize formal or informal mentorship pairings
Maintain logs of faculty participation in development, training, or innovation events
Teaching Effectiveness & Innovation Support
6. Accreditation and Assessment
Manage Accreditation Process
Collect & Curate Evidence for Accreditation Self-Studies
Manage Accreditation Document Repository & Version Control
Maintain Course-Level (CLO) and Program-Level (PLO) Learning Outcomes
Coordinate Annual Learning Outcomes Reporting
Support Faculty with Outcomes Mapping and Rubric Design
Analyze Assessment Results and Recommend Improvements
Close the Loop: Document Changes Based on Assessment Results
Coordinate General Education Assessment (if applicable)
Coordinate Academic Program Review Cycles (e.g., every 5–7 years)
Maintain Program Review Calendar and Templates
Track Progress on Program Review Action Plans
Provide Data Dashboards or Reports for Program Review Committees
Prepare IPEDS and Other Compliance Reports
Support Strategic Planning with Academic Performance Data
Contribute to Annual Institutional Effectiveness Reports
Support External Data Requests from Accrediting Bodies or Agencies
7. Library Services
Manage the selection, acquisition, and licensing of physical and digital library resources
Organize and maintain bibliographic records through cataloging, metadata assignment, and technical processing
Provide user access to library materials through circulation services, course reserves, and interlibrary loan
Deliver research support through consultations, subject expertise, and access to specialized databases
Develop and deliver instruction that builds information literacy and research skills across academic programs
Preserve and provide access to institutional archives, rare books, and unique special collections
Support digital scholarship, repository management, digitization, and the integration of library technologies
8. Continuing Education
Collect and Process CE Payments
Continuing Education for Community Professionals
Maintain and Publish CE Course Information
Maintain and Publish CE Program Information
Maintain CE Academic Records
Process CE Charges for Courses
Produce Consumer Content on Web
Deliver Continuing Education for Community Professionals
Develop Custom CE Programs (corporate, community, or specialty cohorts)
Coordinate with External Partners (e.g., healthcare systems, school districts)
Track CEU Eligibility and Clock Hour Conversions
Assign and Contract CE Instructors
Collect and Approve CE Course Syllabi or Outlines
Evaluate Instructor Effectiveness (separate from regular faculty evaluations)
Maintain Licensing Board Approvals (e.g., ANCC, ACCME, Social Work Boards)
Track CE Program Accreditation (if applicable)
Issue CE Transcripts or Certificates
Track Attendance for CE Compliance Purposes
Provide Learner Tech Support (for online platforms or hybrid events)
3a. Teaching and Learning
1. Instructional Delivery & Engagement
Deliver Lectures / Facilitate Course Sessions (live or recorded)
Facilitate Independent Collaboration Among Learners
Facilitate Independent Student Research
Facilitate Student Collaboration (team-based projects, group discussion tools)
Lead Case-Based or Simulation-Based Learning
Manage and Supervise Student Clinical Rotations
Manage Student Discussions on Course Content
Use AI Tools for Adaptive or Personalized Learning
2. Instructional Materials & Course Assets
Create and Manage Case Simulations
Develop or Curate Multimedia Content (videos, interactives)
Distribute Course Materials
Integrate Virtual & Augmented Reality Content
Online Course Design & Digital Pedagogy
Open Educational Resources (OER) Development
3. Assessment & Feedback
Collect Student Assignments
Grade Assignments and Exams
Manage Grade Submission, Extensions, and Appeals
Manage Formative Feedback Tools (peer, self-assessment, polling)
Track and Analyze Student Learning Outcomes (within the course)
4. Faculty Innovation & Instructional Design Support
Collaborate with Instructional Designers
Implement Evidence-Based Teaching Strategies
Participate in Teaching and Learning Communities or Workshops
Pilot New Teaching Technologies
4. Financial Services
01. Accounting
Maintain the university’s general ledger and chart of accounts
Reconcile bank accounts and other financial statements
Record journal entries and internal transfers
Manage month-end and year-end closing processes
Prepare internal and external financial reports
Monitor compliance with GAAP, GASB, and other accounting standards
Support financial audits (internal and external)
Track and report depreciation of capital assets
Manage interdepartmental billing and fund transfers
Support grant and fund accounting (if not handled separately)
02. Accounts Payable
Maintain vendor records and tax documentation (e.g., W-9s, 1099s)

r.t: Process and pay vendor invoices
in accordance with university policies and payment terms
Verify invoice accuracy
by matching against purchase orders and receiving records
Manage payment schedules
(e.g., weekly check runs, ACH, wire transfers)
Handle employee reimbursements
including travel, mileage, and small expense claims
Respond to vendor inquiries
and resolve payment discrepancies
Monitor and enforce compliance
with procurement and reimbursement policies

si.t: Oversee purchase request workflows and approvals

r.t: Prepare AP reports
to support cash flow forecasting and audits

si.t: 03. Accounts Receivable
Maintain accurate records of external entities who own payment to the university.
Generate and send invoices for vendor agreements and other contractual obligations.
Monitor outstanding balances, apply payments, and reconcile AR sub-ledger to the general ledger.
Receive, post, and deposit checks, wire transfers, and electronic payments from third parties.
Generate aging reports, flag overdue accounts, and analyze trends for financial reporting.
Coordinate Collections on Delinquent Accounts.
Prepare AR Reports for Audits and Financial Statements
04. Budget Management
Develop and manage institutional budgets at department and unit levels
Track budget-to-actual performance and provide variance analysis
Facilitate annual budget planning cycles and submissions
Provide financial modeling and forecasting for institutional planning
Ensure compliance with funding restrictions and budget policies
05. Controller
Maintain official financial policies and procedures, ensuring alignment with regulatory and institutional standards.
Prepare and certify the university’s annual financial statements in accordance with GAAP/GASB.
Coordinate and support external financial audits (documentation, responses, audit readiness).
Maintain institutional accounting policies and internal financial controls.
Oversee month-end and year-end close processes, including complex journal entries and reconciliations.
Ensure compliance with regulatory financial reporting (e.g., IRS, state agencies, accreditation).
Support long-range financial planning through historical analysis and institutional reporting.
Manage configurations and data structures in financial reporting systems/ERPs.
06. Payroll
Collect and validate employee work hours, leave, and overtime records from timekeeping systems.
Calculate gross-to-net pay, taxes, and deductions for all employee types (salary, hourly, adjuncts, etc.).
Administer benefit deductions, garnishments, union dues, and other withholdings.
Manage direct deposit setup and ensure timely distribution of payments via preferred methods.
Process retroactive pay, off-cycle payments, and resolve errors in payroll transactions.
Maintain payroll compliance and generate required reports
Monitor accuracy, prevent fraud, and perform regular reconciliation of payroll transactions.
Coordinate Payroll Integration with Benefits and Finance
Process year-end and quarterly tax filings and reporting
Maintain secure, accurate payroll files and provide portals for employees to view pay stubs, tax forms, and updates.
07. Purchasing and Vendor Relations
Initiate and approve purchase requisitions and purchase orders
Facilitate RFPs, RFQs, and negotiate contracts to ensure value and compliance
Collect W-9s, validate credentials, and maintain updated vendor records in ERP systems
Work with vendors to secure favorable terms while supporting institutional needs
Resolve PO/invoice mismatches, discrepancies, and payment delays
Maintain records and approvals necessary for federal/state funding audits
08. Receiving and Inventory Control
Receive, inspect, and log incoming goods to ensure accuracy, condition, and completeness
Tag, label, or barcode equipment and assets as required
Manage inventory levels for frequently used or shared items
Maintain receiving documentation for auditing and compliance purposes
09. Treasury and Cash Management
Track incoming/outgoing funds and forecast short-term cash positions.
Open/close accounts, update signatories, and manage banking services.
Execute and record wire transfers, ACH payments, and fund disbursements
Reconcile bank statements and cash balances with the general ledger
Allocate surplus cash to maximize return while preserving liquidity and safety.
Collaborate with Budget and Finance teams on capital planning and major initiatives.
Maintain records for audit, regulatory, and donor compliance
Receive, count, and deposit physical cash and checks from campus departments.
Issue petty cash, change funds, and reimbursements in person.
10. Risk management
Manage institutional insurance coverage (e.g., property, liability, auto, cyber risk)

r.t: Track and investigate incidents and claims
(including workplace injuries, property damage, and liability events)
Coordinate legal and regulatory risk mitigation
in partnership with Legal, Finance, and operational units
Maintain certificates of insurance (COIs) and risk documentation
for vendors, contracts, and events
Support business continuity and disaster recovery planning
across departments

si.t: Perform risk assessments for new projects, vendors, or strategic initiatives

r.t: Develop and deliver risk awareness training
for departments, event planners, or campus-wide audiences

si.t: 11. Business Development
Identify and evaluate alternative revenue opportunities
Develop and maintain strategic partnerships
Negotiate business terms and financial models for collaborative initiatives
Coordinate market research and financial analysis to support new venture proposals
Track performance metrics and ROI for external partnerships, service lines, or auxiliary enterprises
Support grant and contract development for mission-aligned ventures that involve financial risk or revenue
Develop pricing strategies and business plans for new programs, services.
Manage financial modeling and risk analysis for innovation initiatives
4b-new. Facilities & Campus Services
1. Disaster Planning
Coordinate campus-wide crisis communication and physical continuity planning
Ensure emergency readiness for campus infrastructure and critical operations
2. Facilities Asset & Space Management
Maintain accurate records of campus buildings, rooms, and space utilization
Maintain compliance documentation for facilities with specialized regulations (e.g., radioactive materials)
Maintain vehicle maintenance and fleet service records
3. Access & Security Operations
Manage building access systems, key distribution, and campus-wide lock control
Coordinate parking access and permit management
4. Grounds and Environmental Services
Oversee landscaping, groundskeeping, and outdoor maintenance
Coordinate campus sustainability and environmental initiatives (if applicable)
5. Utilities & Core Infrastructure
Operate and maintain campus power plant and utility systems
Manage HVAC, plumbing, electrical, and other infrastructure systems
Track utility usage and efficiency metrics (if relevant to ERP or reporting)
6. Construction & Engineering Services
Track campus construction and renovation job costing
Manage project records for engineering, renovations, and deferred maintenance
Coordinate campus capital improvement projects (in collaboration with Budget/Finance)
7. Auxiliary Services (if applicable)
Oversee food service contracts and daily food service operations
Manage mailroom operations, including incoming/outgoing campus mail and package distribution
Manage textbook procurement, branded merchandise, and school supplies (sometimes outsourced).
Operate campus-wide printing, copying, and reprographics services for students and departments.
Oversee vending machines and refreshment services in academic and residential buildings.
Coordinate facility rentals, guest housing, catering, and event support for internal and external groups.
Operate early childhood education or daycare centers for faculty, staff, and students.
Manage sales and services for campus events, theater, athletics, and special programs.
Operate or manage campus retail locations (coffee shops, convenience stores, etc.).
Provide short-term vehicle rentals or support for university travel logistics.
Coordinate campus transportation services, shuttles, and vehicle scheduling
Operate campus fitness center(s), including memberships, scheduling, and equipment oversight
5. Human Resources
1. Talent Acquisition
Post and manage job openings across internal and external platforms
Coordinate recruitment marketing and outreach efforts
Review applications and screen candidates for qualifications
Schedule and manage interviews with hiring committees or departments
Conduct reference checks and background screenings
Facilitate offer letters, salary approvals, and employment agreements
Track recruitment metrics (time-to-fill, applicant sources, diversity data)
Ensure compliance with equal opportunity hiring practices
Maintain applicant tracking system (ATS) data and workflows
Coordinate onboarding handoff to HR and department managers
2. Employee Services & Records
Maintain personnel files and digital employee records in compliance with retention policies
Process job changes, promotions, terminations, and other employment actions
Issue employment verifications, service letters, and confirmation of titles/salaries
Manage name, address, and demographic updates for employees
Administer employee ID badge creation and access provisioning (if housed in HR)
Track employment history, tenure, and service anniversaries
Support employee inquiries regarding HR policies, processes, or benefits
Process leaves of absence, sabbaticals, and reappointments (non-benefits-related)
Manage onboarding documentation and ensure I-9 and E-Verify compliance
Respond to internal audits and public records requests related to employee information
3. Benefits Administration
Facilitate open enrollment through employee self-service portals
Manage employee benefits enrollment and changes
Process qualifying life events and benefit eligibility updates
Track FMLA and other benefit-related leaves
Generate ACA, COBRA, and compliance reporting
Maintain secure benefits records and audit trails
Sync benefit deductions with payroll and financial systems
4. Compensation & Classification
Maintain and update job classifications, salary grades, and compensation structures
Conduct market analysis and benchmarking studies for salary competitiveness
Manage salary adjustments for promotions, reclassifications, or equity
Coordinate annual compensation review and merit increase processes
Ensure compliance with FLSA and other wage-related regulations
Provide compensation modeling tools and reports for leadership decision-making
Review and approve new position requests and pay ranges
Track total compensation packages (including stipends, bonuses, and allowances)
Collaborate with Finance and Budget on compensation planning
Maintain compensation data integrity within HRIS and reporting systems
5. Performance & Professional Development
Deliver employee orientation sessions (mission, systems, policies, compliance training)
Assign and track completion of required training during onboarding and role transitions
Manage the annual employee performance evaluation process
Design and manage performance review templates, rating scales, and documentation standards
Support goal-setting, performance planning, and development conversations
Support performance improvement plans and coaching interventions
Track training participation, compliance completion, and CEU certifications
Provide systems and support for individualized learning plans and career progression
Coordinate internal training, workshops, and professional development opportunities
Administer mentorship, leadership development, and succession planning programs
6. Employee Relations & Engagement
Document and Respond to employee concerns, complaints, and conflict resolution requests
Conduct investigations into workplace behavior, misconduct, or policy violations
Track employee satisfaction through surveys and feedback tools
Coordinate employee recognition and appreciation programs
Develop and implement employee engagement initiatives
Coordinate Workers’ Compensation claims, documentation, and return-to-work processes
Collaborate with legal or compliance units on risk mitigation
Provide training or support on workplace civility and communication
Promote inclusion and belonging through cross-functional initiatives
7. Compliance, Policy & Reporting
Maintain and update employee handbooks and workplace policies
Ensure compliance with labor laws (e.g., FLSA, FMLA, EEO, Title IX, OSHA)
Coordinate mandatory employee training (e.g., harassment, safety, HIPAA)
Track completion of compliance-related courses or acknowledgments
Respond to federal, state, and institutional reporting requirements
Maintain records for audits and regulatory reviews
Support immigration documentation (e.g., visa tracking, I-9 compliance)
Oversee internal HR audits and risk assessments
Coordinate institutional responses to employment-related legal inquiries

r.t: Maintain and publish official university policies in alignment with compliance and governance standards.
Oversee policy and procedure lifecycle, including approvals, version control, and archival.

si.t: 8. Employee Wellness & Work-Life Balance
Administer employee wellness programs (physical, mental, and financial health)
Coordinate employee assistance programs (EAP) and related services
Promote work-life balance through flexible work policies and resources
Track participation in wellness events, programs, or incentives
Partner with health providers to offer screenings, flu shots, or fitness classes
Provide resources for stress management, burnout prevention, and self-care
Manage wellness-related communications and awareness campaigns
Support caregiving and family-friendly initiatives (e.g., parental leave navigation, lactation spaces)
Collect feedback on wellness program effectiveness
Align wellness strategies with broader institutional goals for retention and engagement
6. Research Administration
1. Sponsored Programs / Pre-Award Administration
Provide guidance on funding opportunities and proposal preparation
Support grant budget development and alignment with sponsor requirements
Review and approve grant proposals for institutional compliance
Coordinate internal routing and approval of proposals
Manage submission workflows and deadlines with external sponsors
Maintain records of proposal submissions and outcomes
2. Post-Award Administration / Research Accounting
Set up and manage sponsored project accounts and budgets
Monitor grant expenditures and ensure sponsor compliance
Generate effort reporting and time & effort certification
Support financial reporting to sponsors and auditors
Coordinate grant closeout and reconciliation
3. Research Compliance
Administer IRB, IACUC, and biosafety protocols and approvals
Track PI certifications and researcher training requirements
Conduct compliance monitoring and site audits
Maintain documentation for adverse events and reporting
4. Research Integrity / Research Misconduct
Promote research integrity standards and responsible conduct
Investigate allegations of research misconduct
Support conflict of interest disclosures and oversight
Manage institutional responses to integrity violations
Maintain confidential records of cases and resolutions
5. Research Development / Strategic Initiatives
Assist investigators in identifying strategic research opportunities
Coordinate collaborative proposals and cross-disciplinary teams
Support early-stage research through seed funding or pilot grants
Provide guidance for innovative research areas (e.g., AI, HPC, data science)
Track research output metrics and strategic alignment
6. Technology Transfer / Intellectual Property
Evaluate and protect institutional inventions and discoveries
Manage patent filings, copyrights, and trademarks
Facilitate licensing, startup development, and commercialization
Draft and negotiate research-related IP and license agreements
Maintain IP disclosure and tracking systems
7. Human Subjects Research Support
Support IRB review processes and maintain documentation for regulatory compliance
Assist researchers with protocol submissions and amendments
Monitor ongoing studies for compliance with approved protocols
Provide training and guidance on informed consent and ethical conduct
Maintain records of adverse events and continuing review outcomes
8. Researcher Development & Mentorship
Provide onboarding support for new researchers and postdocs
Coordinate mentorship programs for early-career faculty
Offer workshops and training in grantsmanship, publishing, and leadership
Track researcher development milestones and training records
Promote institutional resources for career progression and recognition
7. University Advancement
1. Marketing & Brand Management.
Develop and maintain the university’s brand identity, including logos, visual assets, and messaging.
Manage institutional storytelling and brand narrative strategy
Create and manage multi-channel marketing campaigns to support enrollment, events, and fundraising.
Manage digital engagement channels including social media, SEO, and institutional website
Design promotional materials and digital content aligned with institutional goals.
Analyze market research and campaign performance to refine marketing strategies.
Oversee use of university branding across departments to ensure consistency and compliance.
Collaborate across advancement units to align messaging and strategy across campaigns, appeals, and engagement efforts
2. Communications (Internal & External)
Develop and manage internal communications strategies to inform faculty, staff, and students.
Coordinate external communications, including press releases, media statements, and crisis messaging.
Maintain editorial calendars and oversee production of newsletters, announcements, and campus updates.
Manage relationships with media outlets and respond to inquiries on behalf of the institution.
Collect publishable content for newsletters, press releases, and public-facing communications.
Publish official university information through digital, print, and campus-wide channels.
Facilitate staff collaboration via intranet platforms and internal communication tools.
3. Philanthropy / Advancement Services

r.t: Maintain donor database and gift records
to ensure accurate tracking of contributions and engagement history.
Process and acknowledge gifts, pledges, and matching contributions
in a timely and donor-compliant manner.
Generate giving statements and tax receipts
in alignment with IRS and institutional standards.
Ensure compliance with donor restrictions and gift agreements
, including fund usage monitoring.

si.t: Ensure audit readiness through accurate documentation, donor intent tracking, and adherence to fundraising regulations.

r.t: Support gift officers and fundraisers
with prospect research, portfolio development, and cultivation strategy.
Track fundraising performance metrics and campaign progress
for institutional reporting.
Coordinate donor recognition programs and naming opportunities
, ensuring alignment with university policies.

si.t: 4. Alumni & Donor Engagement

r.t: Maintain alumni and donor contact records
to support personalized outreach and engagement.
Coordinate alumni relations programming
, including reunions, networking events, and affinity group activities.
Produce alumni communications
, such as newsletters, magazines, and digital updates.
Facilitate regional, professional, and affinity-based alumni chapters or councils
Manage volunteer opportunities for alumni and donors
, including mentoring, advisory boards, and event support.
Track alumni engagement metrics and participation trends
for strategic planning and reporting.
Support stewardship efforts
through events, impact stories, and donor appreciation campaigns.

si.t: 5. Community Relations / Government Affairs

r.t: Build and maintain relationships with local, state, and federal government officials
to support institutional advocacy.
Coordinate institutional responses to legislation and regulatory proposals
impacting higher education.
Represent the university in community partnerships
, coalitions, and civic initiatives.
Support campus events and activities that foster community engagement
(e.g., town halls, open houses, service days).
Manage institutional participation in economic development and regional planning efforts
Track and report on community impact metrics
(e.g., volunteer hours, service outcomes, economic contribution).
Collaborate with internal stakeholders
on messaging and strategy related to government and community priorities.

si.t: 8. Global and Community Service
1. Community Engagement & Partnerships
Develop and maintain partnerships with local nonprofits, schools, and civic organizations
Coordinate community-based service-learning opportunities for students
Organize community advisory boards or feedback groups
Track and evaluate institutional impact on the local community
2. Global Service & International Outreach
Maintain partnerships with global mission sites, NGOs, and institutions
Coordinate international service programs, mission trips, and clinical rotations
Track international placements and ensure compliance with travel protocols
Maintain records of deferred mission appointees or long-term global service alumni
3. Volunteer & Mentorship Programs
Recruit, screen, and train volunteers for community or institutional initiatives
Match students or alumni with mentorship opportunities (locally or globally)
Track service hours, placements, and participant feedback
Provide recognition and support for mentors, volunteers, and hosts
4. Program Documentation & Reporting
Maintain accurate records of community/global activities for accreditation or reporting
Collect narratives, metrics, and impact data for grants and institutional reports
Collaborate with marketing to publish service stories and campaigns
Manage compliance with international agreements and partnership standards
9. IT, Data & Analytics
01. IS Strategy and Governance
AI & Ethics in Institutional Decision-Making
Develop and enforce IT policies, procedures, and governance frameworks
Facilitate IT steering committees and cross-functional decision-making
Guide institutional adoption of responsible AI and emerging technologies
Lead IT strategic planning aligned with institutional goals
Monitor IT risk and develop mitigation strategies
Oversee enterprise IT compliance, including FERPA, HIPAA, and PCI
Strategic planning, IT governance, policy, compliance, and executive IT alignment.
Support executive decision-making with technology roadmaps
02. Central Enterprise Systems
Coordinate system-wide upgrades and patch management
Core systems such as ERP, SIS, HRIS, and financial platforms with cross-departmental integrations.
Ensure integration between core enterprise applications
Manage and maintain ERP, SIS, HRIS, and financial systems
Oversee vendor relationships and licensing for enterprise platforms
Provide change management for major system transitions
Support institutional reporting, compliance, and workflow automation
03. Infrastructure, Operations & Identity Services
